intro: Scolymus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellowish-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scolymus maculatus is often found in dry, open habitats like fields and roadsides.
